arm_group.description: Patients will receive 1-year treatment with icotinib after operation.
Patients will receive 2-year treatment with icotinib after operation.

brief_summary.textblock:
Adjuvant therapy has been proved effective in treating stage II-IIIA non-small-cell lung
      cancer. This study is designed to evaluate the efficacy of icotinib as adjuvant therapy in
      treating such patients. The primary endpoint is to compare the recurrence-free survival
      after 1-year or 2-year treatment with icotinib.

clinical_study.brief_title: Icotinib as Adjuvant Therapy in Treating Non-small-cell Lung Cancer Patients With Positive EGFR Mutation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The patients signed the written informed consent

          -  The patients present with operable stage II-IIIA non-small-cell lung cancers with 19
             or 21 exon mutation

          -  The patients have no history of anti-cancer therapies including chemotherapy,
             radiation therapy

          -  The patients' Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group scores are ≤ 0-2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with unresected tumor

          -  Wild EGFR type

          -  Allergic to the study drug

          -  Patients have severe non-cancerous diseases

          -  Patients are undergoing current administration of anti-cancer therapies, or are
             attending some other clinical trials

intervention.description: Icotinib is administered orally with a dose 125 mg 3 times daily within 4-6 weeks after operation for 1 year.
Icotinib is administered orally with a dose 125 mg 3 times daily within 4-6 weeks after operation for 2 years.

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Open-label, Multicenter Study of Icotinib as Adjuvant Therapy in Treating Stage II-IIIA Non-small-cell Lung Cancer Patients With Positive EGFR Mutation

reference.citation: Lv C, Ma Y, Feng Q, Fang F, Bai H, Zhao B, Yan S, Wu N, Zheng Q, Li S, Chen J, Wang J, Feng Y, Wang Y, Pei Y, Fang J, Yang Y. A pilot study: sequential gemcitabine/cisplatin and icotinib as induction therapy for stage IIB to IIIA non-small-cell lung adenocarcinoma. World J Surg Oncol. 2013 Apr 26;11:96. doi: 10.1186/1477-7819-11-96.
